mk.tmdb.core
Class TMDbAuthentication

java.lang.Object
  mk.tmdb.core.TMDbAuthentication

public class TMDbAuthentication
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides methods to authenticate to the TMDB site.

Author:
Mirko Polato

TMDbAuthentication

public TMDbAuthentication()
Method Detail

getNewToken

public static TMDbToken getNewToken()
                             throws TMDbResponseException
This method is used to generate a valid request token for user based authentication. A request token is required in order to request a session id. You can generate any number of request tokens but they will expire after 60 minutes. As soon as a valid session id has been created the token will be destroyed.

Returns:
The authentication token
Throws:
TMDbResponseException - Throws whether the server response is not a success.

showRequestAuthorization

public static void showRequestAuthorization(TMDbToken token)
                                     throws TMDbResponseException
Opens the request authorization web page in the default browser.

Parameters:
token - The authentication token
Throws:
TMDbResponseException - Throws whether the server response is not a success.

getNewSession

public static java.lang.String getNewSession(TMDbToken token)
                                      throws TMDbResponseException
This method is used to generate a session id for user based authentication. A session id is required in order to use any of the write methods.

Parameters:
token - The authentication token
Returns:
The authenticated session ID
Throws:
TMDbResponseException - Throws whether the server response is not a success.

getNewGuestSession

public static java.lang.String getNewGuestSession()
                                           throws TMDbResponseException
This method is used to generate a guest session id. A guest session can be used to rate movies without having a registered TMDb user account. You should only generate a single guest session per user (or device) as you will be able to attach the ratings to a TMDb user account in the future. There is also IP limits in place so you should always make sure it's the end user doing the guest session actions. If a guest session is not used for the first time within 24 hours, it will be automatically discarded.

Returns:
The authenticated session ID for a guest
Throws:
TMDbResponseException - Throws whether the server response is not a success.
